definition: United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: Many of the gentlemen leaders of the Revolution subscribed to Radical Whig political thinking.
sentences.chinese: 许多革命的菁英领袖赞同急进民权党的政治思想。

sentences.english: "It's going to be an extremely limited, elite audience that would see a production in any case, " said Robertson.
sentences.chinese: 不论如何，能去看戏的观众都是人数非常有限的菁英。

sentences.english: The information of the files ranged from details of people lives to analysis of opinion about the government among its elite.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案纪录人民生活细节及分析菁英对政府的意见。

sentences.english: This year, Taiwan's best are ready.
sentences.chinese: 今年，台湾菁英已经准备好了。

sentences.english: What do you expect to and have the capacity to contribute to Elite Club?
sentences.chinese: 您希望并且能够为菁英会贡献什么？

sentences.english: The tools for the top, BEC steers you towards success.
sentences.chinese: 成为菁英的工具，商务英语引领你走向成功。

sentences.english: He became Vice-Chairman of the elite, but also Vice-Chairman of the Hong Kong-China Youth Federation.
sentences.chinese: 他当上菁英会副主席，也是香港青联副主席。

sentences.english: Welcome you to join our elite team create a better future.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎菁英的你加入我们的团队共创未来。

sentences.english: Secular Humanism has emerged as the dominant faith of the elite.
sentences.chinese: 世俗人文主义成为菁英界的主要信仰。

sentences.english: It smacks of spiritual pride and elitism.
sentences.chinese: 它有点属灵骄傲与菁英的味道。

sentences.english: I have no idea what you the elites were thinking about at that moment?
sentences.chinese: 那一刻真不明白你们这些菁英份子在想些甚么。

definition: to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
repository of items of cultural significance/collection
to work for/to devote one's efforts to
peer/member of the same class, generation or social group
to make a pilgrimage (to visit a holy site)/to go on a sightseeing tour
to have as its purpose/to be intended to/to aim to (do sth)
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
